content.question: In highlighting “the safety with which error of opinion may be tolerated,” Jefferson was referring most directly to

choices.label: passage of the Alien and Sedition Acts, which were designed to suppress criticism of the government
Great Britain’s efforts to deny colonists their political rights in the years before the American Revolution
the use of government force to put down popular uprisings like Shays’ Rebellion and the Whiskey Rebellion
restrictive anti–American Indian policies that conflicted with the nation’s professed political ideals

content.answer: passage of the Alien and Sedition Acts, which were designed to suppress criticism of the government
